section.title: Set the Perspective to JBoss
section.para: JBoss Developer Studio has JBoss perspective. This displays tabs, toolbars and menu items most often used by developers using JBoss. These include Project Explorer, Palette, Servers and OpenShift Explorer.
If you start JBoss Developer Studio, this perspective is set as the default and it is automatically displayed.
If you start Eclipse, this perspective is not automatically displayed. To show the JBoss perspective, click the JBoss icon. Alternatively, click Window→Open Perspective→Other and select JBoss.

To set JBoss perspective as the default perspective, click Window→Preferences. Expand General and select Perspectives. Select JBoss from the list of available perspectives and click Make Default. Click Apply and click OK to close the Preferences window.
